DOC.detailed_description: Depression serious illness affect person 's mood , thought , physical well-being . Common symptoms depression include persistent feeling anxiety , guilt , hopelessness ; irregular sleep appetite pattern ; lethargy ; disinterest previously enjoy activity ; excessive irritability restlessness ; suicidal thought ; inability concentrate . Depression often occur presence one disorder . For example , depression report high rate people chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) general population . COPD disease lung damage , make difficult breathe . Symptoms commonly include chronic cough shortness breath . A primary cause COPD cigarette smoking . Following prescribed treatment plan important manage COPD . Unfortunately , people COPD often adhere treatment plan . Being depressed make adherence even difficult . This study evaluate effectiveness problem-solving therapy integrate adherence-enhanced procedure ( PSA ) treat old people major depression COPD . Participants open label study randomly assign one two group : PSA PID-C . In PSA , therapist teach participant problem-solving strategy focus treatment adherence , depressive symptom , disability . Participants learn behavior solution help cope problem . In PID-C , therapist teach participant identify obstacle treatment adherence discover way overcome . The treatment session group initiate inpatient Pulmonary Unit Burke Rehabilitation Hospital continue participant ' home . All participant receive two treatment session hospitalization , eight weekly session follow discharge , four monthly session . While hospitalized Burke , participant also undergo assessment interview 1.5 hour another interview 20 minute 2 week follow initial assessment . Interviews last 1.5 hour also occur home participant Weeks 10 , 14 , 26 discharge Burke . All assessment focus depression severity , level general functioning , COPD treatment adherence .
